sen.j: 櫛山古墳（くしやまこふん）は、奈良県天理市柳本町に所在する古墳時代前期後半の双方中円古墳である。
sen.e: Kushiyama Kofun is a candy-wrap-shaped tumulus (keyhole shape with one more handle) constructed in the latter half of the early Kofun period (tumulus period) located in Yanagimoto-cho, Tenri City, Nara Prefecture.

Kushiyama-kofun Tumulus is a candy-wrap-shaped tumulus (keyhole shape with one more handle) constructed in the latter half of the early Kofun period located in Yanagimoto-cho, Tenri City, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 櫛山古墳は、柳本古墳群の一つで、行燈山古墳の後円部に接して、より山側の高い位置にある。
sen.e: As one of the Yanagimoto Kofun-gun Tumuli, Kushiyama Kofun abuts on the rounded rear part of Andon-yama kofun Tumulus and is on the uphill toward the mountains.
As one of the Yanagimoto-kofun Tumuli Cluster, Kushiyama-kofun Tumulus abuts on the back circular part of Andonyama-kofun Tumulus and is on the upper hill toward the mountains.

sen.j: 双方中円墳という特異な墳形をしている。

sen.j: この特異な墳形では、岡山県の楯築遺跡や香川県高松市の石清尾山（いわせおやま）古墳群の猫塚古墳がある。
sen.e: As for the tumuli with this unique shape, there are Tatetsuki Tumulus in Okayama Prefecture and Nekozuka Kofun Tumulus of the Iwase Oyama Kofun-gun Tumuli in Takamatsu City, Kagawa Prefecture.

sen.j: 櫛山古墳や猫塚は、古墳前期でもその後半に属する古墳で、楯築遺跡よりも100年ばかり後に築造された。
sen.e: Kushiyama Kofun and Nekozuka Kofun were constructed in the early Kofun period, but in the latter half of the same period, which corresponds to about 100 years later than Tatetsuki Tumulus was constructed.

sen.j: 櫛山古墳は、猫塚のように、二つの方形突出部がほぼ均等な大きさでなく、むしろ普通の前方後円部にもう一つの短い突出部を付けたというような変形している。
sen.e: Kushiyama Kofun has the irregular shape of an ordinary keyhole-shaped tumulus with another short protruding square-shaped part added to its rounded rear part, not like Nekozuka which has two protruding square-shaped parts of almost the same size.

Kushiyama-kofun Tumulus has the irregular shape of an ordinary keyhole-shaped tumulus with another short protruding square-shaped part added to its back circular part of the front square part, not like Nekozuka which has two protruding square-shaped parts of almost the same size.

sen.j: 墳丘長152メートル、中円部直径約90メートル。

sen.j: 中円部の西側に前方部、東側に後方部を備えた双方中円憤である。
sen.e: It is a candy-wrap-shaped tumulus with a square-shaped front part on the westside of its rounded part and a square-shaped rear part on the eastside of it.
It is a candy-wrap-shaped tumulus with a front square part on the west of its middle circular part and a back square part on the east of it.

sen.j: 段築は中円部・後方部3段と前方部2段に築かれていた。
sen.e: The rounded middle part and the square-shaped rear part were terraced three-tiered and the square-shaped front part two-tiered.
The middle circular part and the back square part were terraced three-tiered and the front square part two-tiered.
The middle circular part and the back square part were terraced three-tiered and the front square part two-tiered.

sen.j: 30センチぐらいの大きさの葺き石が憤丘全体に葺かれていたと見られている。
sen.e: It is understood that the soil over the whole burial mound was covered by about 30-centimeter Fuki-ishi stones.
It is understood that the soil over the whole burial mound was covered by approximately 30-centimeter fukiishi (a stone covering an old tomb).

sen.j: 中円部はほぼ正円形、前方部は正方形で前面の広がりや正面の弧状がない。
sen.e: While the rounded middle part is almost perfect circle, the square-shaped front is regular square without the frontal expanse and the arc shape in front.
While the middle circular part is almost perfect circle, the front square part is regular square without the frontal expanse and the arc shape in front.

sen.j: 周濠を持っていない。

sen.e: The square-shaped rear part is short and slightly expanded in front.

sen.j: 排水施設を備えていて、長さ5メートル、幅3.4メートルの土抗も検出されている。

sen.j: 太平洋戦争中に日本軍がこの近くの平野部に飛行場を建設した時に、櫛山古墳の一部が掘り荒らされた。
sen.e: At the time of the construction by the Japanese army of an airport in an open field nearby during the Pacific War, a part of Kushiyama Kofun was messed up by digging.

sen.j: 中円部の頂上で長さ7.1メートル、幅1.4メートルの竪穴式石室が発掘され、内部には組合せ式の長持形石棺の一部が検出された。
sen.e: A 7.1-meter long, 1.4-meter wide vertical stone chamber was discovered on the top of the rounded middle part and inside a part of an assembled slab Nagamochi-gata (chest-shaped) stone coffin was detected.

A 7.1-meter long, 1.4-meter wide vertical stone chamber was discovered on the top of the middle circular part, in which a part of an assembled slab Nagamochi-gata (chest-shaped) stone coffin was detected.

sen.j: 後方部には埋葬施設はなかったが、祭祀施設がある。
sen.e: In the square-shaped rear part, there was no burial facilities, but Saishi (religious service) facilities existed.

sen.j: 埋葬が終わった後、様々な日常品や土製の勾玉や管玉を故意に破損させて石ころと共に、大きく掘られた穴の中に投げ入れるつという祭祀が行われた。
sen.e: After the burial was finished, a religious service was performed by throwing intentionally broken various articles for daily use, earthen Magadama (comma-shaped beads) and Kudatama (cylindrical beads) together with pebbles into a large hole dug in the ground.

sen.j: 後方部の祭祀状遺構で、石釧（いしくしろ）、車輪石、鍬形石、石製釧と呼ばれる碧玉製腕飾類の破片、それら三種の碧玉製品を模造した土製品の破片、碧玉の管玉、鉄剣・刀子の破片と鉄斧、位牌形石製品とよばれ、人形の形骸化したい試製品と想像される遺物、高坏や壺などの土師器が出土した。
sen.e: From the ancient structural remnants of Saishi facilities, the following items were excavated : fragments of Hekigyoku (jasper) wristbands which are called Ishikushiro (stone bracelet), Sharinseki (carved stone objects with smooth radial fluting), Kuwagata-ishi (hoe-shaped bracelets), bracelets made of stone, fragments of clay artifacts copied from those three kinds of Hekigyoku products, Kudatama made of Hekigyoku, fragments of iron swords and Tosu (small knife), iron axes, relics presumed to be dolls which turned into a mere shells and Haji potteries including Takatsuki (small one-legged tray for one person) and jars.

Following items were excavated from the site of Saishi facilities in the back square part: Fragments of Hekigyoku (jasper) stone wristbands which are called Ishikushiro (stone bracelet), Sharinseki (carved stone objects with smooth radial fluting), and Kuwagata-ishi (hoe-shaped bracelets), fragments of clay artifacts copied from those three kinds of Hekigyoku products, Kudatama made of Hekigyoku, fragments of iron swords and Tosu (small knife), iron axes, relics called ancestral tablets shaped stone products which are presumed to be sample dolls' wreck, and Haji potteries including Takatsuki (small one-legged tray for one person) and jars.

sen.j: 碧玉製腕飾類は、もとの個体数にして石釧107、車輪石105、鍬形石23という膨大な量であるし、乱掘後残された数に過ぎないから、どれだけ多数が使われたかが分かる。
sen.e: As far as the Hekigyoku (jasper) wristbands are concerned, the number of pieces in their original unbroken forms were so large as 107 for Ishikushiro, 105 for Sharinseki and 23 for Kuwagata-ishi and the number was only for the pieces which survived the reckless digging, therefore, how large the numbers used were can be presumed.

Since vast number of remaining Hekigyoku were excavated after the digging without any plans, such as 107 Ishikushiro, 105 Sharinseki and 23 Kuwagata-ishi counted by their original unbroken forms, it can be presumed how large the numbers Hekigyoku were used.
